{
    "number": 7952,
    "data": "0,1,3,5,9,11,17,21,29,33,41,47,57,59,77,81,101,107,117,131,149,153,173,191,209,213,239,257,273,281,321,329,359,371,401,417,441,453,497,509,539,569,611,621,647,671,717,731,779,801,839,869,917,929,989,1001,1053,1067",
    "name": "Generated by a sieve: keep first number, drop every 2nd, keep first, drop every 3rd, keep first, drop every 4th, etc.",
    "comment": [
        "Also called the sieve of Tchoukaillon (or Mancala, or Kalahari).",
        "If k+1 occurs at rank i for the first time, then i is given by the program: i = 0: for j = k to 1 step -1: i = 1 + i + int ( i / j ): next: - Claude Lenormand (claude.lenormand(AT)free.fr), Jan 15 2001",
        "A082447(n+1) = (number of terms <= n); see A141262 for primes. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 21 2008"
    ],
    "reference": [
        "D. Betten, Kalahari and the Sequence \"Sloane No. 377\", Annals Discrete Math., 37, 51-58, 1988.",
        "Y. David, On a sequence generated by a sieving process, Riveon Lematematika, 11 (1957), 26-31.",
        "M. Le, On the Smarandache n-ary Sieve, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 10, No. 1-2-3, 1999, 146-147."
    ],
    "link": [
        "L. K. Mitchell, <a href=\"/A007952/b007952.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..7549</a>",
        "D. M. Broline and _Daniel E. Loeb_, <a href=\"http://arXiv.org/abs/math.CO/9502225\">The combinatorics of Mancala-Type games: Ayo, Tchoukaillon and 1/Pi</a>, J. Undergrad. Math. Applic., vol. 16 (1995), pp. 21-36.",
        "P. Erd\u0151s and E. Jabotinsky, On a sequence of integers ..., Indagationes Math., 20, 115-128, 1958. <a href=\"http://www.renyi.hu/~p_erdos/1958-08.pdf\">part I</a> <a href=\"http://www.renyi.hu/~p_erdos/1958-09.pdf\">part II</a>",
        "N. J. A. Sloane, <a href=\"http://neilsloane.com/doc/sg.txt\">My favorite integer sequences</a>, in Sequences and their Applications (Proceedings of SETA '98).",
        "F. Smarandache, <a href=\"http://www.gallup.unm.edu/~smarandache/OPNS.pdf\">Only Problems, Not Solutions!</a>",
        "<a href=\"/index/Si#sieve\">Index entries for sequences generated by sieves</a>"
    ],
    "formula": [
        "Equals A002491(n) - 1. Equals A108696 - 2."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "f[n_] := Fold[#2*Floor[#1/#2 + 1] &, n, Reverse@ Range[n - 1]]; Array[f, 55] (* From David Wilson *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) a(n)=if(n<1, 0, t1=n; c=1; while(c<sum(k=1, n, if(k<0, 0, t0=1; u=k; while(t0*floor(u/t0)>0, t0++; u=t0*floor(u/t0)); t0)), t1=floor((2*c+1)/2/c*t1);c++); t1) [_Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 18 2013]",
        "(Haskell)",
        "a007952 n = a007952_list !! n",
        "a007952_list = f 1 [0..] where",
        "   f k (x:xs) = x : f (k + 1) (g xs) where",
        "     g ws = us ++ (g vs) where (us, _:vs) = splitAt k ws",
        "-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 19 2014"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A002491, A007952, A028920, A028931, A028932, A028933, A108696, A140060, A141271, A141272."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy,nice",
    "offset": "0,3",
    "author": "_N. J. A. Sloane_, R. Muller",
    "ext": [
        "Corrected and extended by _David W. Wilson_"
    ],
    "references": 19,
    "revision": 47,
    "time": "2017-07-02T09:21:19-04:00",
    "created": "1996-03-15T03:00:00-05:00"
}
